text: Maryna Bazanova (, 25 December 1962 â€“ 27 April 2020) was a Russian handball player. He competed for the Soviet Union in the 1988 Summer Olympics and for the Unified Team in the 1992 Summer Olympics. She won two bronze medalist. Bazanova was born in Omsk, Soviet Union. Bazanova died on 27 April 2020 in Bremen, Germany at the age of 57. ==References== Category:1962 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Olympic bronze medalists for the Soviet Union Category:People from Omsk Oblast Category:Handball players
title: Maryna Bazanova
